title: 1st European Barndoor Gathering UK cruise to Amersfoort

posts.content:
Claushema wrote:hello,

I am joining the convoy in France but I thought the ferry was from Dover to Dunkerque but now I read Dover to Calais. Am I confused? Please let me know so I show up in the right place at 9am.
Also please add me to the convoy list:

ClausHema 1966 Deluxe
It is Dover to Dunkerque For the main Cool Flo cruise anyway, or Hull to Roterdam for the ones from the north of the UK.
Thanks for that. We'll be waiting on the docks for you folks. Any idea where the meet up for both groups is?

Just slight change to Northern Convoy as me & Clare were on separately. Don't want to be accused of inflating the numbers Blakey

Dave, Cee & the darkside

Premier Inn Dover Central (Eastern Ferry Dock)...... Staying here on Thursday 17th if anyone's interested !!

http://www.premierinn.com/en/hotel/DOVP ... y-terminal

Ready for that early boat on Friday!!!!

50! Another magic number!
Fifty Barndoors pre-registered to the '1st European Barndoor Gathering & Vintage VW Show' and I know of more to come!
This will be an amazing sight! Two words: BE THERE!!

Drive your Vintage VW to Amersfoort - www.BenPon.nl

Premier Inn booked on 17th the good thing about this place is it overlooks where the hardcore Vdubbers will sleep on the harbour front . Tried that last year before EBI but just couldn,t settle . should be a nice VW village in Dover the night before

Wow. Although I'm driving down from Holland just to turn around and convoy back I'm feeling kinda lame for not crossing over and getting up at 4am to take the boat back to France. Need to find a hotel on the French side where I can safely park while waiting for you all. I 'm not even going to go into my Barndoor envy.
There is a very cheap, clean hotel on the 1st roundabout from the docks in Dunkerque. http://www.premiere-classe-dunkerque-su ... index.aspx

sausage fingers wrote:There is a very cheap, clean hotel on the 1st roundabout from the docks in Dunkerque. http://www.premiere-classe-dunkerque-su ... index.aspx
Thanks for that.
I am worried about leaving the bus alone all night. Any thoughts on that. It does have a remote starter cut-off and GPS tracking. Is there going to be anyone sleeping in a camper on the docks who could keep an ear out?

And besides the big amount of Barndoor buses you are also welcome with your "other" Vintage VW!!
We already have 15 splitwindow and oval beetles registered, be sure to check them out and register yourself for the 'Ben Pon Show' in April! - www.BenPon.nl

OMG!
More and more Barndoor registrations are coming in!! ...51, 52, 53, 54, 55, 56, 57!!

Thanks for the support everyone!

YES!! It happened, this is amazing!!
We reached the magic number of 59 Barndoors, this means the World Record of 58 Barndoors in one location (record was set during the OCTO Meeting, June 2012 in California) will be broken!

Today's status January 15, 2014 is: 59 Barndoors, 15 Beetles, 53 Splitbuses and 4 other vehicles registered to the Ben Pon Show from 15 countries!!!
Who's next!? Register now via www.BenPon.nl ...be there!

THANKS EVERYONE FOR THE SUPPORT!!!
We can't wait to welcome you'll in Amersfoort, the Netherlands!

Claushema wrote:
sausage fingers wrote:There is a very cheap, clean hotel on the 1st roundabout from the docks in Dunkerque. http://www.premiere-classe-dunkerque-su ... index.aspx
Thanks for that.
I am worried about leaving the bus alone all night. Any thoughts on that. It does have a remote starter cut-off and GPS tracking. Is there going to be anyone sleeping in a camper on the docks who could keep an ear out?
er hear it being started from 24 miles away ? I doubt it lol
Take the rotor arm out or the main ht lead off ?
